attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8R8enCYcAsYay75O_description
attribs.current:
[[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]]

These numbers may be arranged in any order.
If you dont like these stats you may do 27-point buy with this calculator: http://1-dot-encounter-planner.appspot.com/point-buy-calculator.html

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFEPdrZ2Q-nJL--OBDK_description
attribs.current: Starting at the 1st level, the Plague Doctor has in their possession a set of medical herbs, powders, flowers and seeds. These components are used by the Plague Doctor to concoct various mixtures that can be either beneficial or diabolical. All expended uses of Doctor's Components are replenished upon completing a short or long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFEPlzf00zsIBO9Jy-1_description
attribs.current: Starting at the 1st level, a Plague Doctor has access to an array of tools specifically designed for their class. The tools are unique to them, and the Plague Doctor is proficient in their use.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFES-du7QuhSFrlOaP7_description
attribs.current:
Always on the lookout for danger, you gain the following benefits:

You can’t be surprised while you are conscious.

You gain a +5 bonus to initiative.

Other creatures don’t gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFFxlYv9i2IZukCtoIo_itemcontent
attribs.current: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any Ability Checks you make to Identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create Antitoxin and potions of healing.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFG5fU2ewo1wE9H1QbX_description
attribs.current: Starting at the 2nd level, the Plague Doctor has learned how to concoct certain powders and pastes wrapped in cloth, which can produce certain effects. As an bonus action, you may attach one Poultice to a target that you can touch within 5 feet of you. Each Poultice costs 3 Doctor's Components to create. The creation time for a Poultice is 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFG5rtg5jIq3wWN-NTp_atk_desc
attribs.current: For the patient who ails from poison. One poisoned target that you touch with this Poultice will is cured of the poisoned condition and has resistance to poison for a number of rounds equal to your intelligence modifier (minimum of 1)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFG6Eo2SwO9TdI1oAsZ_atk_desc
attribs.current: When a patient suffers from disease, nothing works better than natural oils. One diseased target that you touch with this Poultice is instantly cured of any nonmagical illness

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFG6MZTnnXIpjv85bkR_atk_desc
attribs.current: A Poultice that burns like the real thing. Make a melee attack to place the Poulice onto a target, the target will then take 1d4 fire damage every turn for 1 minute. At the beginning of the target's turn, they may make a Dexterity save to remove the Poultice. Otherwise, it simply falls off after one minute.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFG6enZlcEInnshwM5E_atk_desc
attribs.current: Wonderful for tea, but dreadful for patients with cuts. Make a melee attack to place the Poulice onto a target, after they have been attacked takes 1d4 poison damage for a number of rounds equal to your intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFG76Dpw5Q6CGqojX1G_atk_desc
attribs.current: Not as effective as a bandage, but will do in a pinch. A target that you touch with this Poultice will recover HP equal to 1d6+your intelligence mod.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFG7RRbqmEA3XzjY1UO_description
attribs.current: At the 3rd level, your expertise lets you know just how and where to make the deepest cut. Using an action, you make a melee, on a hit the target takes the normal damage and suffers bleeding for a number of turns equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). This bleeding deals 1d6 damage each turn. If the enemy is healed by either magical or non-magical means will cause the bleeding from this feature is stopped.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFIFotLgRs96pnhMyzv_description
attribs.current: Starting at the 5th level, the Plague Doctor has learned to more effectively use their Doctor's Components. For the cost of 2 Poultices, you can now craft a more powerful Tonic. As an bonus action, you may drink a tonic, offer it to others to drink, or throw it 20 feet at a target. The creation time for 1 Tonic is 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFIG1AYTJtnp-kkh69Q_description
attribs.current: Delicious on it's own as a drink, this Tonic is perfect for the patient who suffers from nervous conditions. For 1 hour after drinking this Tonic, the effects of being charmed or frightened are suppressed for the duration. After one hour is passed, the debilitating status effects are back in effect, until another Orange and Pomegrantate Tonic is drunk.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFIH9VL-601Yzkv31cx_atk_desc
attribs.current: Refreshing as it is fragrant. This bitter Tonic is able to stimulate the body and grant 2d8 of temporary HP for 10 minutes, or until the temporary HP is depleted.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFIHHtvPE0SxDNMVTAW_atk_desc
attribs.current: Not for consumption. Make a ranged attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 piercing damage. Hit or miss, the shard then explodes. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d8 bludgeoning.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFIHVOsZ-o9NJsa9B2w_description
attribs.current: Though normally poisonous, the Plague Doctor has found a way to make this herb harmless and loosen joints. Upon drinking, your movement speed increases by 10 feet for 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFIHTAR61IvF49QfEQY_atk_desc
attribs.current: Used more as a way to mercifully euthanize terminal patients, but also perfect to bring down enemies. This tonic can be thrown 30 feet at an enemy target for 1d8 poison damage. The affected creature must them make a constitution save or become poisoned.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFPiY4VQlstVWkqq-Yn_description
attribs.current: At the 6th level, the Plague Doctor has been exposed to disease enough times that they no longer have to worry about being infected. Their knowledge of disease has given them the ability to avoid infection, and become immune to disease.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFQk2eDSec9qXXdUD1C_description
attribs.current:
At the 7th level, your knowledge as a Plague Doctor has led you to treating a variety of creatures. In addition to flesh and blood creatures, you can choose to become proficient at fighting against oozes, plants, constructs or undead. This gives you an extra 1d6 in damage against them using slashing, bludgeoning or piercing damage. You may choose another creature to become proficient against at the 13th level, and again at the 18th level. You may not choose any creature to become proficient against more than once.
Whenever you choose a creature to become proficient against, the effects of your features will affect them, regardless of resistance or immunities.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFEPwZFbfpIJgw9xNOJ_atk_desc
attribs.current: If the creature is a plant or oozes +1d6

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFG7hlh1vQ80LL9SwAh_atk_desc
attribs.current: If the creature is a plant or oozes +1d6

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LFHD3BXk5Xx5kYbkJxr_atk_desc
attribs.current: If the creature is a plant or oozes +1d6

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFQkcP9ObEnhMCi3sZB_description
attribs.current:
At the 7th level, you have learned what muscles move what parts of the body. Using an action, you can make a melee attack on a creature within 5 ft of you, and stop a targets limbs from functioning, Each stack lasts for a number of rounds equal to half of your intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). This feature only works if the attack used is one that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and regain expended uses upon finishing a long rest. You target one of the following limbs:

Leg: The target's speed is halved. It is reduced to zero if you target the other leg before the duration expires.

Arm: Target cannot use or interact with objects or weapons with the chosen arm. Cannot use either if you do so before they recover.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFQtgPJST0Z9lmO1cq-_description
attribs.current: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFW7hr4eZFDDdsQxMyL_description
attribs.current: When initiative is rolled, you gain the effects of a dodge action. You may also move up to your movement towards an ally adjacent to an enemy, Moving the ally into the last location you were before reaching them within 5 feet. Neither you or your ally suffer opportunity attacks when this ability is used. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your CON mod per day.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFYVERUkI3OzUWv-r97_description
attribs.current: This outfit can worn with light or medium armor without any loss to Armor Class, but cannot be effectively worn with heavy armor. Anyone wearing this outfit while attuned to it has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and contracting a disease. You similarly have resistance to any damage from airborne poison, such as from the cloudkill spell.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFYWxhAb6HpVl2aYm4e_description
attribs.current:
You have trained extensively with specialized or particularly unique weapons. When you take this feat, gain proficiency with one exotic weapon of your choice.

Characters without this feat or its equivalent do nto have access to the burst fire or special properties when using exotic weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYZPsXiNl0E4Jaicdc_itemcontent
attribs.current: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYZPsXiNl0E4Jaicdc_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Light Armor, AC: 12, Ac +1

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFji8PCwCDf3B4FD7h8_description
attribs.current: At the 9th level, you gain the ability to create Decoctions. For the cost of two Tonics, these strong teas are created for a more powerful effect than before. As an bonus action, you may drink a Decoction, or give it to others to drink. The creation time for a Decoction is 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFjiE8xPg8Q9yFcSJaq_description
attribs.current: Pungent and savory, this Decoction is perfect for regulating body temperature. Upon drinking, you become resistant to fire or cold damage for 1 hour. You are also resistant to the corresponding environment of the damage type you choose.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFjiJLRUMqfdYG5s8Yd_description
attribs.current: Fragrant, but bitter, this Decoction is for the patient who needs some extra fortitude. Upon drinking, you become resistant to 1 damage type (Lightning, Acid, Poison, Thunder, or Necrotic) of your choice for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFjiTBpEAwlm97wx5Zp_description
attribs.current: Tea brewed from herbs with interesting properties. Upon drinking, you become open to the awareness of fey and undead within 60 feet of yourself.(you can not pinpoint which one it is) The effect of this Decoction lasts for 30 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFjiYV5p6yBGYJxyZIF_description
attribs.current: A miracle of medicine that tastes quite bitter, but works wonders. The drinker of this Decoction is immediately cured of any disease and negative condition they have.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LG5h1frOe6ggNSLhWSg_description
attribs.current: At the 10th level, When you take a long rest, you may forgo an amount sleep to spend time to make poultices, tonics, decoctions and cocktails. In order to gain any benefit during a long rest that you make use of this feature, you can only make poultices, tonics, decoctions and cocktails or rest in a combination for the full duration of the long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LGBjGu-Wudm-abWJkq-_itemcontent
attribs.current:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

**Absorption (Very Rare).** While this pale lavender ellipsoid orbits your head, you can use your reaction to cancel a spell of 4th level or lower cast by a creature you can see and targeting only you.

Once the stone has canceled 20 levels of spells, it burns out and turns dull gray, losing its magic. If you are targeted by a spell whose level is higher than the number of spell levels the stone has left, the stone can’t cancel it.

**Agility (Very Rare).** Your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this deep red sphere orbits your head.

**Awareness (Rare).** You can’t be surprised while this dark blue rhomboid orbits your head.

**Fortitude (Very Rare).** Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this pink rhomboid orbits your head.

**Greater Absorption (Legendary).** While this marbled lavender and green ellipsoid orbits your head, you can use your reaction to cancel a spell of 8th level or lower cast by a creature you can see and targeting only you.

Once the stone has canceled 50 levels of spells, it burns out and turns dull gray, losing its magic. If you are targeted by a spell whose level is higher than the number of spell levels the stone has left, the stone can’t cancel it.

**Insight (Very Rare).** Your Wisdom score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this incandescent blue sphere orbits your head.

**Intellect (Very Rare).** Your Intelligence score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this marbled scarlet and blue sphere orbits your head.

**Leadership (Very Rare).** Your Charisma score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this marbled pink and green sphere orbits your head.

**Mastery (Legendary).** Your proficiency bonus increases by 1 while this pale green prism orbits your head.

**Protection (Rare).** You gain a +1 bonus to AC while this dusty rose prism orbits your head.

**Regeneration (Legendary).** You regain 15 hit points at the end of each hour this pearly white spindle orbits your head, provided that you have at least 1 hit point. 

**Reserve (Rare).** This vibrant purple prism stores spells cast into it, holding them until you use them. The stone can store up to 3 levels worth of spells at a time. When found, it contains 1d4 − 1 levels of stored spells chosen by the GM.

Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 3rd level into the stone by touching it as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the stone. If the stone can’t hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

While this stone orbits your head, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the stone is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

**Strength (Very Rare).** Your Strength score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this pale blue rhomboid orbits your head.

**Sustenance (Rare).** You don’t need to eat or drink while this clear spindle orbits your head.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGEKXTTDZfV3RiTR9cB_description
attribs.current:
Choose one ability score. You gain the following benefits:

Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in saving throws using the chosen ability.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGFBkI97xNJnMHBnRaS_description
attribs.current: At the 11th level, you have learned a technique that nullifies the mind. Using an action on a creature that is incapacitated, you are able to cut into the mind of a creature within 5 feet of yourself, they are unable to cast spells for a number of turns equal to your intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).You may use this feature again after you take a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LGhd9bKMmR6iwvuAqRZ_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Requires Attunement

While wearing this ring, you have resistance to cold damage. In addition, you and everything you wear and carry are unharmed by temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIYrXhR6lHKc6fM8ePP_description
attribs.current:
You have inexplicable luck that seems to kick in at just the right moment.

You have 3 luck points. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional d20. You can choose to spend one of your luck points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

You can also spend one luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a d20, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or yours.

If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled.

You regain your expended luck points when you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LIzjX5gTpMr56OH3tgk_itemcontent
attribs.current: A poisoner’s kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other Equipment necessary for the Creation of Poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any Ability Checks you make to craft or use Poisons.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LK7UY5M9qixezVs6cjA_atk_desc
attribs.current: If the creature is a plant or oozes +1d6

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LK7UnpT3dw7YsnINR1a_atk_desc
attribs.current: If the creature is a plant or oozes +1d6

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM7NGQBVGq1uMg6oewO_description
attribs.current: At 14th level, you have acquired access to a powerful sedative. As an action, you may attempt to inject a creature within 5 feet of you with anesthesia. Make a melee attack roll. On a hit, you may expend three or more components. Roll 2d10 + 1d10 for every three components spent and add your plague doctor level to the result; if the total is equal to or greater than the creature’s remaining hit points, the creature is rendered unconscious for amount of hours equal to your intelligence modifier or until you use an action to wake them.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LQvV0vI9Vg8B6i2iGiZ_description
attribs.current: At the 15th level, you have learned how to make the most precise cuts. As an action, you are able to treat the target's AC as 10 regardless of their current AC. This feature only works if the weapons used are an Amputating Knife, a Plague Lancet or a Bonesaw. You may use this feature 3 times, and regain expended uses upon finishing a long rest.
